results.title: He acts his age
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Ages and Stages”.
How a child’s emotional development normally keeps pace with their physical growth; the behavior they exhibit at certain ages. This introductory film examines the play habits of children from one to fifteen years of age and shows the characteristics of each group.

results.title: He = On
results.brief_description: Animated film about a man’s desire to get away from his nagging wife using alcohol as his ploy. Black humour with adult themes.

results.title: He's not the walking kind
results.creator_credit: Sandra Wilson, Peter Jones and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: The story of a young man who, despite a crippling malady is determined to experience as many of life’s offerings as possible. Brian Wilson is a spastic, confined to a wheelchair, but he works at a job, looks after himself, moving about from place to place on his own. Every day has its challenges and victories and sometimes defeats. An insight into the private daily struggle of the handicapped.

results.title: Hazard
results.creator_credit: Tom Stobart, Geoffrey Sumner and Interfilm Productions
results.brief_description: An accident prevention film intended primarily for showing to new workers entering the steel industry. Aims at a person’s attitude to safety rather than suggesting specific safety rules, through the story of two steelworkers on a mountaineering holiday. Compares their attitude to risks in the mountains with a professional attitude to risks on the job.

results.title: Hayley Mills storybook volume 3
results.brief_description: Hayley Mills presents 6 animated children’s tales including: “Myra”, “I’m not Oscar’s friend anymore”, “Martha Ann and the mother store”, “The Man who had no dream”, plus two tales from the Brothers Grimm, “Hans in luck” and “Three golden hairs”.

results.title: Hayley's home movie
results.creator_credit: Gail Singer, John Spotton, Michael Scott and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: Part of the Finding Our Way series, which deals with contemporary family-life issues, this is the story of twelve-year-old Hayley, who must acknowledge the finality of parental separation when her father’s new girlfriend abruptly enters her life. All the issues surrounding separation are realistically evoked. Hayley’s anger, and her fantasy about her parents reuniting, are the central focus. But Hayley’s personality is irrepressible; she finds strength in her own imagination and creativity, thus effecting the beginnings of a resolution.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Gail Singer, John Spotton, Michael Scott and ONF | NFB

results.title: Hayes Jones
results.creator_credit: Jerry Forman, Hugh King, Daniel Ruffini and Allegro Film Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “One Man”.
The story of New York’s new Commissioner of Recreation, a newly created post. Hayes Jones, former Olympic high hurdler, administers 900 parks, is activity director for eight million people and supervisor of 12,000 employees. We follow him through a typical working day.

results.title: Hayburners
results.creator_credit: Tom Robertson and Multi Media Productions
results.brief_description: Young Will Bennett has been assigned a steer to raise and to groom for a 4H club contest, but he is sadly disappointed in the “Hayburner” he has ended up with. A middle-aged retarded helper named Joe enters the scene and sees promise in the animal. Together Will and Joe work to win with Mickey. Based on the novel by Gene Smith.

results.title: Hawks and sparrows = Uccellacci e uccellini [Widescreen]
results.brief_description: In Pasolini’s picaresque serio-comic fable-essay-confession on the theme of social justice, a father and son set out to emulate St. Francis of Assissi’s mission to convert the birds to Christianity. Wandering the Italian landscape, they encounter a wise talking crow, who follows them along retelling left wing parables. Cast includes Toto and Ninetto Davoli. Musical score by Ennio Morricone.
